clickrup 0.0.2

Time tracking 2.0

Source: R/api-timetracking-v2.R
api-timetracking-2.Rd

Working with time tracking in ClickUp tasks. Note: A time entry that has a negative duration means that timer is currently ongoing for that user.

cu_get_time_entries_within_date_range(team_id, start_date, end_date, assignee)

cu_get_singular_time_entry(team_id, timer_id)

cu_get_running_time_entry(team_id, timer_id)

cu_create_time_entry(team_id, ...)

cu_remove_tags_from_time_entries(team_id, ...)

cu_get_all_tags_from_time_entries(team_id)

cu_add_tags_from_time_entries(team_id, ...)

cu_change_tag_names_from_time_entries(team_id, ...)

cu_start_time_entry(team_id, timer_id, ...)

cu_stop_time_entry(team_id)

cu_delete_time_entry(team_id, timer_id)

cu_update_time_entry(team_id, timer_id, ...)

Arguments

team_id

Team ID.
start_date

POSIX start time in milliseconds.
end_date

POSIX end time in milliseconds.
assignee

User ids to filter by separated by commas. Note: Only Workspace Owners/Admins have access to do this.
timer_id

Timer ID.
...

Named arguments to be passed to API request body, see the ClickUp API documentation (https://clickup.com/api).

Value

A cu object.

See also

api-timetracking-legacy for Time tracking legacy API, cu for the cu object class, cu_date_from() and cu_date_to() to deal with POSIX times.

  • Value
